Package pieces

Class Rook

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.Rook
public class Rook
extends Piece
Rook is a subclass of the abstract Piece class and Rook.java provides the implementation needed for a Rook chess piece

  • Method Details

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove​(Board board, java.lang.String move)
      validMove checks if the move made by a player can be made
      Specified by:
      validMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      move - the input of the player containing the current position of the piece as well as the end position
      Returns:
      true if the move inputted by the used is a valid move

    • checkPiecesInPath

      public boolean checkPiecesInPath​(Board board, int startRank, int startFile, int endRank, int endFile)
      checkPiecesInPath checks if there are any pieces in between the current position and the desired position the player wants to move to given that the desired position is left, right, up, or down from the current position of the rook
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      startRank - the row of the current position of the piece
      startFile - the column of the current position of the piece
      endRank - the row of the desired position
      endFile - the column of the desired position
      Returns:
      true if there are no pieces in the path

    • isKingInCheck

      public boolean isKingInCheck​(Board board)
      isKingInCheck checks if the king is in check by a rook
      Specified by:
      isKingInCheck in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - Board object where the game is being played on
      Returns:
      true if the rook could kill a king if the king is not moved immediately

      public java.lang.String toString()
      toString gets the name of the piece

      Returns:
      name of piece
